Author: Don King#8901
Content:
PIRATE is a perfect crypto for storing wealth, or as Satis group say, 

Key Takeaways
â€¢ We estimate the amount of cryptoasset market 
value needed to support economic activities to 
expand from ~$500B next year to $3.6T in 2028
â€¢ 90%+ of cryptoasset value will be derived from 
penetration of offshore deposits in the next decade
â€¢ Currency and Privacy networks will be the largest 
beneficiaries, as most fundamental value will stem 
from store of value use cases
â€¢ Upside (5-yr) In BTC ($96k), XMR ($18k)

PIRATE is better privacy than monero, so it's perfect for offshore alternative market, which as Satis group analysts say, is where much of crypto upside will come from. The whole valuation report is worth reading too

https://www.newsbtc.com/2018/08/30/research-firm-satis-group-predicts-bitcoin-at-144000-in-10-years-bitcoin-cash-at-180/

Author: wookie#7663
Content: I like the idea of PIRATE. I've always believe in privacy right from day 1 of being in crypto. PIRATE is better than both Monero and ZCash, which according to the article are #2 and #3 in line after BTC. I'm not a programmer, but I hope that the there is enough drive with the dev team to figure out the technical difficulties.

Author: Don King#8901
Content: The biggest lesson to learn in crypto is patience,  it is taking a long time for komodo to get the respect it deserves,  but in the last 6 months I am seeing greater awareness about kmd, especially the Chinese gov ratings, and binance CEO CZ giving a thumbs up. As the komodo ecosystem  grows and matures, PIRATE can become a very useful tool as the deep hodl 'offshore' account, and if the community started using it for this purpose, it might eventually approach a stable value against kmd, without any formal peg.

Content: PIRATE doesn't need any cool features, it doesn't need to be a Swiss army knife, it already has a killer feature as a perfect anon coin, and it will grow in adoption as kmd does,

Author: Don King#8901
Content: I like both big privacy coins, monero and Zcash, and PIRATE is the best parts of both - anon by default like xmr, but with stronger privacy set of Zcash, and without the founders tax. PIRATE is a the perfect compliment to kmd as it adds a super private token to the whole ecosystem, which lets kmd be the transactional coin.

Author: Don King#8901
Content: The only criticism monero community has over PIRATE will be trusted setup, on every other point PIRATE is superior to monero.

Author: Don King#8901
Content: Trusted setup is accepted by most users, so eventually people will see PIRATE as the best privacy coin in the cryptosphere

Author: Flexatron#8809
Content: Are there devs on this?

Author: Don King#8901
Content: It's  feature complete as an anon store of value now, PIRATE is to kmd what z is to t, just on an ecosystem level,  if  komodo users start using PIRATE for their 'offshore' accounts I'm sure there'll be enough guys with dev talent around to maintain things.

Author: Don King#8901
Content: The only problems I see are 1-2 years down the road, when mining reward drops off , and in the short term getting on an exchange

Yeah I just found this 1 million dolalls worth of BTC in a treasure chest. ðŸ˜‚

Author: Don King#8901
Content: If PIRATE achieves a stable value relative to kmd it has huge utility,  my belief is privacy coins will come under increasing attack soon, and probably some big exchanges start removing monero. If pirate stays legal, store some of your  after tax wealth in PIRATE for security against theft, if anon coins become  illegal then you probably need the best privacy coin to hide from the gov agents. Either way, PIRATE has great utility as long as it achieves a stable value against kmd.

Author: Don King#8901
Content: My plan is to keep 10-20% of my komodo ecosystem wealth in PIRATE,  assuming it achieves some level of adoption in the next 6 months

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all that is needed is for an exchange to support z transactions for deposit and withdraw

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: nothing else is needed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: people trust the exchange to track the tokens deposited and traded anyway

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so you send a z-tx to the exchange, trade it and withdraw to z-address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: PIRATE is feature complete, just has some 2 year out issues due to the fast emission rate

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but people can always just CPU mine it to keep the chain going

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: adding dPoW is the one thing that would really help PIRATE, by letting notaries do transaparent tx, it would allow notarizations. that wont be a difficult thing to do. but without a central exchange that does z-transactions, OTC is the only practical way

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: strangely enough a central exchange becomes the best solution to trade PIRATE!?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the way to enable it is to allow notary pubkeys to do transparent transactions. It would be a simple enough change in the  ac_private handling. it would be a hardfork though

Content: http://pirate.explorer.dexstats.info/tx/82fcab0d590edbd4d781a2f7cc38a3c531c7c475c22c9aa317c4450569dd0d1e

Author: Alright#0419
Content: make the outputs = 0

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: too many problems with that sort of thing. notaries need to be able to operate at least close to normally

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the change is just in main.cpp where it requires it to be a private tx. just need to check for notarypubkey there

Author: scubapanda#2485
Content: If the new coins ie. public addresses & balances would get notarized, would that be enough to stop possible hash power attacks?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: notarization notarizes the blockhash, which includes the merkleroot, which includes all transactions, public and private
